snippet: The New York Times has filed a request that the Justice Department disclose documents from an investigation into C.I.A. torture of detainees, including summaries of interviews with witnesses and documents explaining why no charges were filed.
abstract: Obama administration urges court to reject request to disclose thousands of pages of documents from Justice Dept investigation into torture of detainees by CIA; administration filing comes in response to Freedom of Information Act lawsuit brought by The New York Times immediately following release of Senate Intelligent Committee summary of its own investigation.
lead_paragraph: The New York Times has filed a request that the Justice Department disclose documents from an investigation into C.I.A. torture of detainees, including summaries of interviews with witnesses and documents explaining why no charges were filed.

headline.main: U.S. Tells Court That Documents From Torture Investigation Should Remain Secret
headline.print_headline: U.S. Tells Court That Documents From Torture Investigation Should Remain Secret
